graph_generator module¶

class graph_generator.GraphDHNGenerator(control_params: GraphGeneratorParameters = None, verbose=1)¶

Bases: object

Main Class to perform random DHN generator

control_params¶

Control parameters of the generation

Type:

GraphGeneratorParameters

verbose¶

To perform verbose or not (default = 1)

Type:

int

generate_random_connected_dhn()¶

Redundant function to generate the overall synthetic DHN. It calls the function self.generate_random_dhn() and returns None.

Parameters:

None

Returns:

None

generate_random_dhn()¶

Generates the overall synthetic DHN relying on the control parameters defined in the input of the class. It generates sucessively the regions, add random connections between the regions, select random heat producers and perfoms post processing.

Parameters:

None (using control parameters)

Returns:

True if the generation didn’t yield in any errors, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

generate_random_region_with_target(center)¶

Here, we generate a DHN region using the proposed nodes-recursive graph generation but with a ratio (N/E) targeted than a number of nodes to reach. This target illustrates the tree-likeliness of the generated graph and is defined in the control parameters.

Parameters:

center (tuple[float]) – 2D spatial coordinates used as center of the DHN

Returns:

Graph (networkx.Graph)

plot_district_heating_network()¶

Plots the synthetic DHN corresponding to this graph generator class

Parameters:

None

Returns:

None

read_generated_graph(excel_file_topology: str, plot_graph=True)¶

Reads and loads generated graph.

Parameters:

  • excel_file_topology (str) – Path of the excel file containing the generated graph topology

  • plot_graph (bool) – Whether to plot the loaded graph (default = True)

Returns:

None

graph_generator.random() → x in the interval [0, 1).¶

SyntheticDHN
